briefdescription.para: Internal variable for whether this Node can be deleted or not.
Primary node output.
UI position for NodeViews.
Custom user label for node.
Creates a clone of the Node.

detaileddescription.para: By default, the clone will NOT have the values and connections of the original node. The caller is responsible for copying that data with functions like CopyInputs() as copies may be done for different reasons.

briefdescription.para: Return the name of the node.

detaileddescription.para: This is the node's name shown to the user. This must be overridden by subclasses, and preferably run through the translator.

briefdescription.para: Returns a shortened name of this node if applicable.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to returning Name() but can be overridden.

briefdescription.para: Return the unique identifier of the node.

detaileddescription.para: This is used in save files and any other times a specific node must be picked out at runtime. This must be an ID completely unique to this node, and preferably in bundle identifier format (e.g. "org.company.Name"). This string should NOT be translated.

briefdescription.para: Return the category this node is in (optional for subclassing, but recommended)

detaileddescription.para: In any organized node menus, show the node in this category. If this node should be in a subfolder of a subfolder, use a "/" to separate categories (e.g. "Distort/Noise"). The string should not start with a "/" as this will be interpreted as an empty string category. This value should be run through a translator as its largely user oriented.

briefdescription.para: Return a description of this node's purpose (optional for subclassing, but recommended)

detaileddescription.para: A short (1-2 sentence) description of what this node should do to help the user understand its purpose. This should be run through a translator.

briefdescription.para: Function called to retranslate parameter names (should be overridden in derivatives)
Return accelerated capabilities of this node (if any)
Generate hardware accelerated code for this Node.
Generate hardware accelerated code for this Node.
Number of iterations to run the accelerated code.

detaileddescription.para: Some code is faster if it's merely repeated on a resulting texture rather than run once on the same buffer.

briefdescription.para: Parameter that should receive the buffer on an iteration past the first.
Clear current node variables and replace them with.
Save this node into a text/XML format.
Return a list of NodeParams.
Return the index of a parameter.

simplesect.para: Parameter index or -1 if this parameter is not part of this Node

briefdescription.para: Return a list of all Nodes that this Node's inputs are connected to (does not include this Node)
Returns a list of Nodes that this Node is dependent on, provided no other Nodes are dependent on them outside of this hierarchy.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to GetDependencies(), but excludes any Nodes that are used outside the dependency graph of this Node.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve immediate dependencies (only nodes that are directly connected to the inputs of this one)
Generate a unique identifier for the shader code (if a node can produce multiple)
Return whether this node processes samples or not.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeValueDatabase &values, const AudioRenderingParams &params, const SampleBufferPtr input, SampleBufferPtr output, int index) const
memberdef.name: ProcessSamples

briefdescription.para: If ProcessesSamples() is true, this is the function that will process them.
Returns the input with the specified ID (or nullptr if it doesn't exist)
Returns the output with the specified ID (or nullptr if it doesn't exist)
Returns whether this Node outputs data to the Node n in any way.
Return whether this Node has input parameters.
Return whether this Node has output parameters.
Return whether this Node has input parameters and at least one of them is connected.
Return whether this Node has output parameters and at least one of them is connected.
Severs all input and output connections.
Transforms time from this node through the connections it takes to get to the specified node.
Find a node of a certain type that this Node outputs to.
Signal all dependent Nodes that anything cached between start_range and end_range is now invalid and requires re-rendering.

detaileddescription.para: Override this if your Node subclass keeps a cache, but call this base function at the end of the subclass function. Default behavior is to relay this signal to all connected outputs, which will need to be done as to not break the DAG. Even if the time needs to be transformed somehow (e.g. converting media time to sequence time), you can call this function with transformed time and relay the signal that way.

briefdescription.para: Signal through node graph to only invalidate frames that are currently visible on a ViewerWidget.
Adjusts time that should be sent to nodes connected to certain inputs.

detaileddescription.para: If this node modifies the time (i.e. a clip converting sequence time to media time), this function should be overridden to do so. Also make sure to override OutputTimeAdjustment() to provide the inverse function.

briefdescription.para: The inverse of InputTimeAdjustment()
Return whether this Node can be deleted or not.
Set whether this Node can be deleted in the UI or not.
Returns whether this Node is a "Block" type or not.

detaileddescription.para: You shouldn't ever need to override this since all derivatives of Block will automatically have this set to true. It's just a more convenient way of checking than dynamic_casting.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this Node is a "Track" type or not.

detaileddescription.para: You shouldn't ever need to override this since all derivatives of Track will automatically have this set to true. It's just a more convenient way of checking than dynamic_casting.

briefdescription.para: The main processing function.

detaileddescription.para: The node's main purpose is to take values from inputs to set values in outputs. For whatever subclass node you create, this is where the code for that goes.

Note that as a video editor, the node graph has to work across time. Depending on the purpose of your node, it may output different values depending on the time, and even if not, it will likely be receiving different input depending on the time. Most of the difficult work here is handled by NodeInput::get_value() which you should pass the time parameter to. It will return its value (at that time, if it's keyframed), or pass the time to a corresponding output if it's connected to one. If your node doesn't directly deal with time, the default behavior of the NodeParam objects will handle everything related to it automatically.

briefdescription.para: Return whether a parameter with ID id has already been added to this Node.
Convert a pointer to a value that can be sent between NodeParams.
Convert a NodeParam value to a pointer of any kind.
Copies inputs from from Node to another including connections.

detaileddescription.para: Nodes must be of the same types (i.e. have the same ID)

briefdescription.para: Signal emitted when a node is connected to another node (creating an "edge")
Signal emitted when a node is disconnected from another node (removing an "edge")
Signal emitted whenever the position is set through SetPosition()
Signal emitted when SetLabel() is called.
Add a parameter to this node.

detaileddescription.para: The Node takes ownership of this parameter.
This can be either an output or an input at any time. Parameters will always appear in the order they're added.

briefdescription.para: A node generated from an external XML metadata file.
